DOC.HEAD: Michael Quinlan New McDonald's Chairman
DOC.TEXT: Michael Quinlan, president and chief executive of McDonald's Corp., will became chairman of the world's biggest restaurant company on March 31, McDonald's announced today. Chairman Fred L. Turner, 56, will become senior chairman and continue as chairman of the executive committee, McDonald's said in a statement. Quinlan, 45, will head a relatively youthful senior management team which also includes Ed Rensi, 45, president of McDonald's USA, and Jim Cantalupo, 46, president of the company's international operations. In a statement, Turner said the move ``positions our senior management well for the 90s.'' ``I will continue to participate with them as we strive to develop the McDonald's system to its potential,'' he said. Quinlan has spent 26 years with the fast-food leader, which is based in the Chicago suburb of Oak Brook and has 11,000 restaurants in more than 50 countries. ``We are a unique and special company,'' he said in a statement. ``I am excited and optimistic about continuing and furthering the tradition of excellence that our company has always represented.''
